context:
After age 70, maybe 75, the elderly should be made to take a driving test every few years.

We finally had to take the keys away from my grandfather at 92. If he lived in the city, not four miles outside a 500 population town, we would have taken the keys ten years earlier.

replies.context: Every year in my opinion.  My Dad was a travelling salesman who probably drove 2 million miles in his time.  His later years he was a horrible driver, of course the dementia didn't help.  It was a blessing of a kind when his car was repossessed.

context: Sounds like Biden leading the country.
The storage and maintenance fees for our beloved criminals is way too high. Amerika can no longer afford to foot the bills. Amerika has a mobile crematorium, use it.
Probably confused the brake and gas pedals.
Gives a whole new meaning to the term drive thru.

Right pedal is Go
Left pedal is Stop

Old people like Joe forget even the easiest of things...  like who has recently dropped dead

Such details as usual....
Journalism is dead
Another case of No common Sense.... After 70 Mandatory driving tests required.....
Misdemeanor?  That seems a bit off.
